_header: Saint Peres the friar preacher in the city of Verona
Subjects: Peres, saint, life of; saints’ lives
_description: Life of St. Peres (Peter) in the South English Legendary

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn Peres þe frere prechour In þe cite of beronyeIbore
                    was of mysbilievned men þat were al in eresie…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…At þe endyng of aueryl he þolede MartirdomGod ous
                    bringe to þulke Ioie þat his soule to com

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint peter þe frere prechour In þe cite of veronyeI bore
                    was of mysbyleued men þat were al in erersyȝe…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…now god for þe loue of seint peter bring vs to þilke
                    blisseþer þat he is brouȝt to & þer of þat we
                    ne mysse

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
SEint Peter þe frere prechour in þe Cite of VeronyeI bore
                    was of luþur Men þat weren in heresye…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Atte ende of Aueril he þolede MartirdomGod vs bringe to
                    þat Ioye þat his soule to com. A. M. E. N.

Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Seint Peris þe ffrere prechour in þe Cite of VeronyeYbore
                    was of mysbyleouede men þat þo were in heresye…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Atten ende of þe mounþe of Aueril he þolede
                    þis martyrdomGod vs bringe to þulke ioye þat his soule to
                    com

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint peres þe frere prechure in þe cite of versiebore
                    was of mysbyleued men þat were in eresie…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…atte þan endyng of aueryl he þoled marterdomgod ous
                    bringe to þulke Ioie þat his saule to come
